newsitem.title: USA: Falcon and Reading & Bates to merge.
newsitem.headline: Falcon and Reading & Bates to merge.

text.p: Falcon Drilling Co Inc and Reading & Bates Corp said on Thursday that the boards of both companies approved a definitive agreement for a $5 billion merger.
The deal will create a new company, R&B Falcon Corp, a news release issued by the comanies said.
Falcon Drilling shareholders are to get one share of R&B Falcon Corp common stock for each share of Falcon Drilling common stock, the news release said.

Reading & Bates shareholders will get 0.59 shares of R&B Falcon common stock, which exchange ratio will be adjusted to 1.18 to give effect to the previously announced Falcon Drilling stock split, for each share of Reading & Bates common stock, the release said.
The exchange of shares for both companies is expected to be tax free and the companies will seek pooling of interests accounting treatment, the release said.
Reading & Bates President, Chairman and Chief Executive Paul Loyd will be chairman of the new company, the news release said.
The transaction is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 1997, the companies said.
The new company will have a fleet of 14 vessels capable of drilling in water deeper than 3,000 feet, the companies said.
Steven Webster, chairman and chief executive of Falcon Drilling, will be the president and chief executive officer of the new company, the news release said.
The new company's 10-member board will be made up of five members appointed by Falcon Drilling and five appointed by Reading & Bates, the release said.
Webster called the combination a "significant consolidation opportunity in the fast growing, highest margin segment of the drilling industry - deepwater."
Loyd said he expects to see the benefits of the transaction "almost immediately."

"Given that Steve and I have known each other and worked together for over 25 years and that we do not expect any significant layoffs at the operating level, I am confident of our ability to achieve a seamless and rapid integration of our operations," Loyd said.
Falcon Drilling provides offshore drilling services for the international oil and gas industry.
Falcon's fleet of 82 drilling units services the international deepwater, the offshore Gulf of Mexico and the worldwide transition zone.

Reading & Bates provides offshore drilling services throughout the world. Its Reading & Bates Development Co unit is in the business of acquiring interests in offshore oil and gas properties and thereby participates in reservoir risk sharing.
